questions.guidance_text: Enter your organization's full legal name as registered. This name will appear on the policy and must match your GST registration and other legal documents to ensure claims are processed smoothly.
Provide your complete office address where all policy-related correspondence should be sent. Include building name, street, area, city, state, and PIN code for accurate delivery of policy documents.
questions.placeholder: e.g., 5th Floor, Tech Park, Bandra Kurla Complex, Mumbai, Maharashtra - 400051

questions.guidance_text: Enter your 15-character GST identification number. This is required for GST input credit on premium paid and helps verify your business credentials. Ensure accuracy as incorrect GST numbers can delay policy issuance.

Provide the name of the person responsible for this insurance who can be contacted for clarifications. This is typically the IT head, facility manager, or administrative officer familiar with your electronic equipment.

Provide a valid email address for receiving policy documents, renewal reminders, and claim-related communications. Use an official company email that is regularly monitored to avoid missing important updates.
Enter a 10-digit mobile number for urgent communications. This number will be used for claim intimation confirmations and emergency assistance during equipment breakdowns or disasters.

Select the date from which you want insurance coverage to begin. For renewal cases, ensure this matches your expiry date to avoid coverage gaps. New policies typically start from 12:01 AM of the selected date.
Electronic equipment policies are typically annual. Some insurers offer long-term policies (2-3 years) with premium discounts. Consider your equipment upgrade cycle when selecting the policy period.

Provide the exact address where your electronic equipment is installed and operated. If different from communication address, this is where risk assessment will be conducted. Include floor details for multi-story buildings.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Ground & First Floor, IT Building, Tech City, Whitefield, Bangalore - 560066

questions.guidance_text: Indicate if your electronic equipment is spread across multiple locations like branch offices, data centers, or warehouses. Multiple location coverage ensures protection regardless of where equipment is situated.

List all additional locations with complete addresses and approximate equipment values at each location. This helps structure the policy with appropriate location-wise sum insured and assess cumulative risks.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Location 2: Mumbai Office - ₹50 lakhs equipment, Location 3: Chennai Warehouse - ₹25 lakhs equipment

questions.question_text: Total Sum Insured for Electronic Equipment
questions.guidance_text: Enter the total current replacement value of all electronic equipment to be insured. This should be the cost to purchase new equipment of same kind and capacity, not depreciated or book value. Under-insurance can lead to proportionate claim settlements.

Select your primary business activity. Different industries have varying risk profiles - IT companies may have higher values of equipment, while manufacturing may have harsher operating conditions affecting premium rates.

Describe the primary purpose for which electronic equipment is used. Equipment in controlled environments like offices face different risks than those in factories or medical facilities, affecting coverage terms and premium.

Indicate typical daily operating hours of your electronic equipment. Continuous operation increases wear and breakdown risk but may also indicate critical systems with better maintenance. This affects risk assessment and pricing.

Select all types of electronic equipment you want to insure. Different categories have varying risk profiles and depreciation rates. Ensure all valuable electronic assets are included to avoid gaps in coverage.

List individual items worth more than ₹10 lakhs with make, model, serial number, and value. High-value items may need specific underwriting approval and might have sub-limits or special conditions applied.
questions.placeholder: e.g., IBM Power System E980 Server - Serial: 123ABC - Value: ₹85 lakhs, Cisco UCS B200 Blade Servers (5 units) - Value: ₹60 lakhs

questions.guidance_text: Indicate the average age of majority of your electronic equipment. Newer equipment has lower breakdown risk but higher values. Equipment over 10 years may have limited coverage or higher excess. Consider your refresh cycle.

Equipment under warranty or Annual Maintenance Contract (AMC) indicates better maintenance and support, leading to favorable premium rates. Insurance covers risks not included in warranty/AMC like theft, fire, or accidental damage.

questions.question_text: Do You Have Existing Electronic Equipment Insurance?
questions.guidance_text: Indicate if you currently have or previously had electronic equipment insurance. Continuous coverage history demonstrates risk awareness and can help negotiate better terms. New buyers may face different terms.
Provide the name of your current insurance company. This helps in policy porting and ensures continuity benefits like no-claim bonus or waived waiting periods are transferred to the new policy.
questions.placeholder: e.g., New India Assurance Company Ltd

questions.guidance_text: Enter your existing policy expiry date to ensure seamless renewal without break in coverage. Gap in coverage may result in loss of continuity benefits and potential waiting periods for certain perils.

Declare any insurance claims made for electronic equipment in the past 3 years. Claims history affects premium and terms but non-disclosure can lead to policy cancellation. No-claim history typically earns discounts.

Provide details of each claim including date, cause of loss, equipment affected, claim amount, and preventive measures taken. Demonstrating improved risk management after claims can help maintain favorable terms.
questions.placeholder: e.g., June 2023 - Power surge damaged 5 computers, Claim: ₹2.5 lakhs, Settled: ₹2.2 lakhs. Installed voltage stabilizers afterward.

questions.guidance_text: Select additional coverages based on your specific needs. Portability cover is essential for laptops, terrorism cover for high-risk areas, and data restoration for critical systems. Each extension increases premium but provides comprehensive protection.

Deductible is the amount you pay per claim before insurance applies. Higher deductibles reduce premium significantly but increase your out-of-pocket expense during claims. Choose based on your risk appetite and claim frequency. You can enter the amount in lakhs or crores (e.g., 50,00,000 or 5,00,00,000).

Select all safety measures implemented at your premises. Better security and preventive measures reduce risk and can earn premium discounts. Insurers may mandate certain measures for high-value equipment or specific locations.

Upload your detailed equipment inventory in Excel format with columns for equipment type, make/model, serial number, purchase date, and current value. This helps accurate sum insured calculation and faster claim settlement.

If renewing or porting, upload your expiring policy document including schedule and endorsements. This ensures continuity of coverage terms and helps identify any gaps that need addressing in the new policy.

Mention any specific requirements, upcoming equipment additions, planned relocations, or unique risk factors not covered above. Include any specific terms from existing policy you want retained or improved.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Planning to add a new data center in Q3 2025, need provision for mid-term inclusion
